snippet: Sales rose for Yum, which controls the Taco Bell, KFC and Pizza Hut brands, but fell short of analyst expectations. Sales fell for PepsiCo, but margins improved.
abstract: Yum Brands reports sales rose 2 percent to  $3.43 billion in quarter ending in September, but notes it earned weaker earnings than expected; profits were $421 million, compared with $404 million in year ago quarter; PepsiCo reports sales have dropped 5 percent, to $16.3 billion, in third quarter.
lead_paragraph: Sales rose for Yum, which controls the Taco Bell, KFC and Pizza Hut brands, but fell short of analyst expectations. Sales fell for PepsiCo, but margins improved.

headline.main: Yum Brands Misses Forecasts, While PepsiCo Exceeds Predictions
headline.print_headline: Yum Brands and PepsiCo Post Mixed Earnings Results
